availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York }: ss,,

I David McAdam residing in the City and County of New York, appointed by his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner for Deeds for the said State of Kentucky to reside in the City and County of New York, Do Solemnly swear that I will well, truly and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner, according to the laws of the said State of Kentucky
Subscribed and Swornto before methis Sixth day of October A D 1862.

Q. McAdam
Notary Public, inthe city of New York

figure.ab:
QUENTIN McADAM
NOTARY PUBLIC
NEW YORK.

body.p:
Official Oath of David McAdam as Comr of Deeds for the State of Kentucky residing in New York City & Count=
Filed October 11. 1862
